director.title: Director of the College
director.subtitle: News, messages and director's blog
director.about_text: Zhaniya Onalbayeva Sarmurzina is an experienced and dedicated leader in the field of education. She was born in the Mangystau region. She holds a higher education degree from the A.S. Pushkin Oral Pedagogical Institute, majoring in Kazakh Language and Literature Teaching. She also holds a Master’s degree in Technical Sciences.
director.career: She began her career in education. From 1992 to 1996, she worked as a teacher in the schools of the village of Shetpe, Mangystau region. From 1996 to 2004, she was a teacher at secondary school No. 20 in Aktau. From 2003 to 2013, she served as the deputy director for scientific and methodological work at the Mangystau Polytechnic College. Since 2013, she has worked in the Department of Technical and Vocational Education of the Mangystau Regional Education Administration. Since September 2025, she has been appointed as the director of the Mangistau College of Tourism.
director.principles_text: Motto: “Quality education is the key to a bright future.” Under Zhaniya Onalbayeva’s leadership, the college’s main goal is to train highly qualified specialists in the field of tourism and services who will contribute to the socio-economic development of the region. She actively promotes quality improvement in education, the implementation of innovative teaching methods, and the systematic development of educational and moral programs, thereby strengthening the reputation of the college.

s1.description: Hotel business is a modern and promising specialty aimed at training qualified professionals for the hospitality industry. Students learn the fundamentals of hotel management, customer service, marketing and reservation systems.
s1.qualification: Upon completion of training, graduates receive the qualification '4S10130104 - Supervisor' and can work in various positions in hotels, resorts and other hospitality establishments.

s2.description: Food organization is a specialty that trains specialists for the food service industry. Students master cooking technologies, confectionery production and restaurant business management.
s2.qualification: Graduates can receive qualifications: '3W10130302 - Cook', '3W10130301 - Pastry decorator', '4S10130303 - Technologist' and work in restaurants, cafes, hotels and other catering establishments.

s3.description: Tourism is a dynamically developing specialty that prepares specialists for the tourism industry. Students study tour planning, excursion activities, tourist routes and customer service in tourism.
s3.qualification: Upon graduation, students receive the qualification '4S10150104 - Tourism Manager' and can work in travel agencies, tourist companies, hotels and recreational facilities.

s4.description: Translation is a specialty that trains qualified translators for various fields. Students master translation techniques, work with different types of texts and develop intercultural communication skills.
s4.qualification: Graduates receive the qualification '4S02310101 - Translator' and can work as interpreters, written translators, in international companies and government agencies.

s5.description: Marketing is a modern specialty that prepares specialists in marketing and advertising. Students study market analysis, brand promotion, digital marketing and customer relationship management.
s5.qualification: Upon completion of training, graduates receive the qualification '4S04140103 - Marketing specialist' and can work in marketing departments, advertising agencies and commercial companies.
